_exec_summary.SummaryText:
GOLDEN VALLEY, INC. IS AN AGRICULTURAL RETAIL BUSINESS THAT SPECIALIZES IN GRAIN STORAGE FOR AREA PRODUCERS AS WELL AS PROVIDING THE NECESSARY INPUTS FOR GRAIN PRODUCTION.   THIS COMPANY STRIVES TO MAINTAIN A SAFE AND HEALTHY WORK PLACE.  OUR OWNERS, MANAGERS AND EMPLOYEES HAVE MADE EVERY EFFORT TO PLAN THE PREVENTION OF ANY ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA. 

THE SANFORD PLANT CONSIST OF ONE 30,000 AND ONE 18,000 GALLON ANHYDROUS AMMONIA STORAGE TANK AND WHEN FILLED TO 85% CAPACITY WILL HOLD APPROXIMATELY 210,100 POUNDS.  WITH THE ADDITION OF 29 NURSE TANKS WITH A CAPACITY OF 126,900 POUNDS MAKES THE COMPANY?S TOTAL CAPACITY OF 337,000 POUNDS AT THE SANFORD LOCATION.

 THE WORST CASE AND THE ALTERNATE RELEASE SCENARIOS HAVE BEEN EVALUATED AND SHARED WITH OUR LOCAL FIRST RESPONDERS AS PART OF AN ON-GOING TRAINING PROGRAM.  MORE IMPORTANTLY, OUR EMPLOYEES HAVE BEEN TRAINED IN THEIR RESPECTIVE EMERGENCY ACTIONS, INCLUDING THE EMERGENCY MEETING PLACE AND EACH OF THEIR INDIVIDUAL RESPONSIBILITIES REGARDING AN ACCIDENTAL RELEASE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA.

THIS COMPANY MAINTAINS AND OPERATES THEIR NH3 PLANT IN STRICT ACCORDANCE WITH ALL STATE AND LOCAL AUTHORITIES.  THE KANSAS DEPARTMENT OF AGRICULTURE INSPECTS OUR PLANT ON A REGULAR BASIS AND WE COMPLY WITH THEIR REQUESTS FOR IMPROVEMENT.  RECOMMENDATIONS BY THE KANSAS DEPT. OF AGRICULTURE, FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND OTHER REGULATORY GROUPS, AS WELL AS OTHER RECOMMENDED CHANGES OR IMPROVEMENTS IN THE FACILITY?S EQUIPMENT, WILL BE ACTED UPON IMMEDIATELY FOLLOWING THE ENFORCEMENT AGENCY (KDA?S) REQUEST, OR AS FOUND TO BE NECESSARY BY OUR CROP PRODUCTION PERSONNEL.

OUR EMPLOYEES ARE TRAINED IN SAFETY PROCEDURES, SITE SPECIFIC OPERATING PROCEDURES, PLANT MAINTENANCE AND THE EMPLOYEES ARE COMPETENCY TESTED OVER THE TRAINING MATERIAL.  EACH EMPLOYEE USES GOGGLES AND GLOVES DURING AMMONIA OPERATIONS AS WELL AS ALWAYS PROVIDING PLENTY OF EMERGENCY SAFETY WATER DURING NURSE TANK LOADING OPERATIONS. 

WITH THE ABOVE-MENTIONED TRA

INING IN MIND, IT MAKES IT VERY EASY TO REPORT THAT ABSOLUTELY NO INJURY ACCIDENTS OR PROPERTY DAMAGE HAS OCCURRED AT THIS FACILITY FOR THE PAST FIVE YEARS.

OUR EMERGENCY ACTION PLAN IS DESIGNED TO MINIMIZE THE RISKS TO EMPLOYEES, THE SURROUNDING PUBLIC AND THE AREA FIRST RESPONDERS.  THIS COMPANY PROVIDES PLANT TOURS FOR OUR LOCAL FIRE DEPARTMENT AND OUR ACTION PLAN HAS BEEN SHARED WITH THE PAWNEE COUNTY LOCAL EMERGENCY PLANNING COMMISSION (LEPC).  EACH OF OUR RESPONDING AGENCIES ARE AWARE OF THE DANGEROUS NATURE OF ANHYDROUS AMMONIA AND THEY HAVE AGREED TO ASSIST US IN THE EVENT OF AN EMERGENCY OR ACCIDENTAL RELEASE.

IN ADDITION, FENCES HAVE BEEN INSTALLED AROUND THE PIPING OF THE PLANT TO DISCOURAGE ANYONE FROM MESSING WITH THE VALVES.
